title: Can you eat eggs after getting vaccinated for COVID-19? | The Times of India
description: The pandemic has made us all realise that the only way to fight against the dreadful virus is by getting jabbed. A common myth that has been floating around social media is that eating eggs post vaccination can be harmful, but is it true or just a mere bluff? Let's find out!
cleaned_text: to eat eggs after getting vaccinated for COVID-19 When it comes to getting vaccinated for COVID-19, there are several inhibitions and questions that often hold us back from getting jabbed. In fact, there are a few myths that revolve around the efficacy of vaccines and foods that must be avoided post vaccine. The pandemic has made us all realise that the only way to fight against the dreadful virus is by getting jabbed. A common myth that has been floating around social media is that eating eggs post vaccination can be harmful, but is it true or just a mere bluff? Let's find out! [readmore](javascript://) 02/4What experts say! According to experts, there's no such post vaccine diet that one needs to follow, but it is advised that one must go for a healthy balanced diet. A nutrient rich diet helps in reducing inflammation and the after effects of vaccines such as fever, faiting, body ache, weakness. Since, the key to strengthen immunity is your gut health, it is best to include foods that help in keeping the gut healthy. Especially foods like fresh veggies, fruits, and wholegrains. healthy plant based protein or lean meats. [readmore](javascript://) 03/4Should you eat Eggs post vaccination? Eggs are super nutritious and are packed with the goodness of protein. One large egg has around 6 grams of protein, which can give your body a healthy boost of nutrition to improve immunity. Eggs contain essential amino acids that cannot be synthesized by the human body and can only be obtained from the food we eat. This is the reason why it is advised to eat eggs every morning to boost immunity and satiety. Post vaccination our body needs a protein rich diet, which also includes foods that have anti-inflammatory properties, this helps in replenishing the lost nutrients and helps in giving the body ample nourshimnet to revive from the after effects of vaccination. [readmore](javascript://) 04/4When should you avoid eating eggs? However, if you are allergic to eggs, then it is a better idea to avoid eating eggs before or after vaccination. Egg allergy happens when the immune system becomes sensitized and overreacts to protein present in egg whites or yolks. The consumption of eggs is treated as a foreign invader, which leads to allergic reactions like rashes, itching and may lead to severe food allergic reactions. So, if you have egg allergy make sure you seek doctor's advice before consuming eggs before or after getting jabbed!
